text: The voiced alveolar fricative is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨z⟩`. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe Adyghe 'one' Albanian Albanian 'fire' Arabic Standard 'visitor' Assamese Assamese 'chili' Assyrian Assyrian ܙܢ̱ܓܐ zìga 'bell' Bengali Bengali 'Salat' Breton Breton 'church' Chechen Chechen зурма / 'music' Dutch Dutch 'seed' Emilian and Romagnol 'reason' English English zoo 'zoo' Esperanto 'cousin' Georgian Georgian 'bell' Greek Athens dialect / záli 'dizziness' Hebrew Hebrew 'wolf' Hindustani Hindi 'land' Hindustani Urdu 'land' Japanese Japanese / 'everything' Kabardian Kabardian 'one' Kalaw Lagaw Ya Kalaw Lagaw Ya 'go' Kashmiri Kashmiri / 'to know' Khmer / noun: 'Belgium', 'Belgian(s)' adjective: 'Belgian' Malay Malay beza 'difference' Maltese Maltese 'zeal' Marathi Marathi 'if' Occitan Limousin jòune 'young' Polish Ꜯbak [zbæ:k] 'ångstrom' Persian [guz] 'fart' Portuguese Portuguese 'house' Punjabi Punjabi ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ 'life' Spanish Andalusian 'Communism' Spanish Latin American 'Communism' Spanish Filipino 'Communism' Spanish Mexican 'island' Swahili Swahili 'must' West Frisian West Frisian 'to say' Yi Yi / 'generation' Yiddish Yiddish / 'son' Zapotec Tilquiapan guanaz 'went to grab' ==References== Category:Consonants
title: Voiced alveolar fricative
